ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Site
Subject type
Notes: 1=MTA randomized trial subject; 2=Local normative comparison group (LNCG) subject

Assessment Point

ElementDescription: Active status
Notes: 0=Inactive-Data collected after the 14 month treatment phase/after early termination from treatment phase/prior to treatment phase; 1=Active-Data collected during the 14 month treatment phase while subject received originally assigned treatment regardless of degree of compliance; 2=Active-This is the last active assessment for subjects who were about to violate treatment arm by receiving alternate treatment; 3=Active-This is the last active assessment for subjects who were about to leave the study by moving away;4=Yes, Active; 5=No, Not Active

ElementDescription: wave 1= September to December, wave 2= April to June, wave 3=summer months
Notes: wave 1= September to December, wave 2= April to June, wave 3=summer months

ElementDescription: Cohort
Current Grade
Treatment Group Assignment
Notes: 1=Assessment and referral; 2=Medication treatment only; 3=Combined medication and psychosicial treatment; 4=Psychosocial treatment only; 5=Local Normative Comparison Group

ElementDescription: Treatment group
Notes: M=Medication only; C=Combined medication and psychosocial; P=Psychosocial only; A = Assessment and Referral; L = LNCG (Local Normative Comparison Group)

ElementDescription: End of treatment category
Notes: 1 = There has been improvement over time, and/or the child is now doing well generally (CGI's now no higher than 1 or 2); 2 = Child's progress and behavior has been "so-so," and some further improvement is needed (any most recent CGI of 3); or there is no clear pattern per se, but there have been some "ups and downs," suggesting child may benefit from some additional treatments; 3 = There has been some worsening or gradual deterioration over time, and/or the child is not doing well (defined as any most recent CGI of 4). More treatment is clearly needed, both clinically and ethically; 99 = No debriefing visit took place; no recommendations given

ElementDescription: Randomized Subjects: Was child receiving Stimulant Medication at Telephone Screening, i.e., prior meds?
MTA Psychosocial Treatment: Parent Training Attendance %
MTA Psychosocial Treatment: Summer Treatment Program (STP) Days ABSENT
MTA Psychosocial Treatment: ParaProfessional Aide (Classroom Aide) Number of Days
MTA Psychosocial Treatment: Therapist Consultant (TC) School Consultation - Number of Meetings with Teacher
MTA Psychosocial Treatment: Therapist Consultant (TC) School Consultation - Last Month of Contact
MTA Titration Trial: Participation
Notes: 0 = Not Participating. It is used for subjects who did not participate at all in titration. (n=18) 1 = Completed titration trial. (n=256) 10 = Cooperated and began participation in titration trial but trial abandoned during lead-in due to side effects or sensitivity to higher doses. Child placed directly into maintenance. (n=4) 11 = Titration trial begun but ended early due to compliance or lack of data; or trial completed but outcome decision based on less than adequate data.

ElementDescription: MTA Titration Trial: Name of Medication Prescribed as a Result of Titration Trial or as a Result of Another Decision (for subjects with insufficient titration data)
MTA Titration Trial: Total Daily Dose Prescribed (only for Ritalin)
MTA Titration Trial: Daily Ritalin Schedule
MTA Medication Treatment: Number of Monthly Medication Clinic Visits
MTA Medication Treatment: Number of Monthly Intervals on Treatment
MTA Medication Treatment: Number of Months Covered
MTA Medication Treatment: Compliance Code 1 for the Medication Component
Notes: 1 = Completed 14 months on assigned treatment with good compliance throughout. (NB: This includes those cases where the 14-month assessment was done as early as 12 months, if the subject met the above definition for as few as 12 months but through to the assessment.) (n=230) 2 = Completed 14 months on assigned treatment with reasonable compliance throughout. (n=14) 3 = Completed 14 months on assigned treatment with poor compliance throughout. (n=3) 4N = Total Non-Compliance - No treatment received; refused participation right after treatment assignment. (n=18) 4S = Began assigned treatment but stopped (quit, withdrew, refused to continue) prior to the end of the14-month treatment period. (n=17) 5 = Accepted and/or began assigned treatment but moved out of the area prior to the end of the 14-month treatment period. (n=4) 6 = �Cross-arm violator� prior to the end of the 14-month treatment period

ElementDescription: MTA Medication Treatment: Compliance Code 2 for the Medication Component
Notes:
1 = Completed 14 months on assigned treatment with good compliance throughout (NB: This includes those cases where the 14-month assessment was done as early as 12 months, if the subject met the above definition for as few as 12 months but through to the assessment.) OR Completed less than 14 months on assigned
treatment (e.g., stopped early) but received medication for at least 80% of the 14-month treatment period. (n=238) 2 = Completed 14 months on assigned treatment with reasonable compliance throughout OR Completed less than 14 months on assigned treatment (e.g., stopped early) but received medication for at least 50% (up to 79%) of the 14-month treatment period. (n=19) 3 = Completed 14 months on assigned treatment with poor compliance throughout OR Completed less than 14 months on assigned treatment (e.g., stopped early) and received medication for less than 50% of the 14-month treatment period. (n=13) 4 = Total Non-Compliance: No treatment received; refused participation or moved right after treatment assignment. Includes all subjects where MEDCODE1=4N

ElementDescription: MTA Psychosocial Treatment: Compliance Code 1 for the Psychosocial Component
Notes: 1 = Completed 14 months on assigned treatment with good compliance throughout. (NB: This includes those cases where the 14-month assessment was done as early as 12 months, if the subject met the above definition for as few as 12 months but through to the assessment.) (n=160) 2 = Completed 14 months on assigned treatment with reasonable compliance throughout. (n=38) 3 = Completed 14 months on assigned treatment with poor compliance throughout. (n=39) 4N = Total Non-Compliance: No treatment received; refused participation right after treatment assignment. (n=1) 4S = Began assigned treatment but stopped (quit, withdrew, refused to continue) prior to the end of the 14-month treatment period. (n=5) 5 = Accepted and/or began assigned treatment but moved out of the area prior to the end of the 14-month treatment period. (n=8) 6 = �Cross-arm violator� prior to the end of the 14-month treatment period

ElementDescription: MTA Psychosocial Treatment: Compliance Code 2 for the Psychosocial Component
Notes: 1 = Completed 14 months on assigned treatment with good compliance throughout (NB: This includes those cases where the 14-month assessment was done as early as 12 months, if the subject met the above definition for as few as 12 months but through to the assessment.) OR Completed less than 14 months on assigned treatment (e.g., stopped early) but otherwise met the criteria for good compliance. (n=183) 2 = Completed 14 months on assigned treatment with reasonable compliance throughout OR Completed less than 14 months on assigned treatment (e.g., stopped early) but otherwise met the criteria for reasonable compliance. (n=46) 3 = Completed 14 months on assigned treatment with poor compliance throughout OR Completed less than 14 months on assigned treatment (e.g., stopped early) but otherwise met the criteria for poor compliance. (n=59) 4 = Total Non-Compliance: No treatment received; refused participation or moved right after treatment assignment. Includes all subjects where PSYCODE1=4N
